Closed issue "FieldCode (w:instrText) does not preserve whitespace" (#833) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Description**

When using field codes with leading or trailing whitespace, the whitespace is lost.

This is a problem because it can cause problems with nested fields in Word, e.g. `{ IF { DATE }=...`

**Information**

- .NET Target: .NET Framework
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.12.0

**Repro**

```csharp
var code = new FieldCode("IF ");
Trace.WriteLine(code.OuterXml);
``` 

**Observed**

```xml
<w:instrText xmlns:w="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/wordprocessingml/2006/main">IF </w:instrText>
```

**Expected**

```xml
<w:instrText xmlns:w="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/wordprocessingml/2006/main" xml:space="preserve">IF </w:instrText>
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "OpenXML SDK will throw exception when a percentage with % char" (#875) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
# Before submitting an issue, please fill this out

Is this a:
- [x] Issue with the OpenXml library

**Description**

When the document contains `%` characters, I use the OpenXML SDK to read a percentage value, an exception will be thrown. 

**Information**

- .NET Target: All
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.12.0

https://github.com/lindexi/lindexi_gd/tree/9b506dea/RurlejileGearhuheljale

```csharp
                    var background = slide.CommonSlideData.Background;
                    var backgroundProperties = background.BackgroundProperties;
                    var solidFill = backgroundProperties.GetFirstChild<SolidFill>();
                    var solidFillRgbColorModelHex = solidFill.RgbColorModelHex;
                    var alpha = solidFillRgbColorModelHex.GetFirstChild<Alpha>();
                    try
                    {
                        int alphaVal = alpha.Val;
                    }
                    catch (Exception e)
                    {
                        // Input string was not in a correct format.
                        Console.WriteLine(e);
                    }
``` 

The document:

```xml
    <p:bg>
      <p:bgPr>
        <a:solidFill>
          <a:srgbClr val="383747">
            <a:alpha val="100.00%" />
          </a:srgbClr>
        </a:solidFill>
      </p:bgPr>
    </p:bg>
```

**Observed**

The code throw exception

```
int alphaVal = alpha.Val;
```


**Expected**

It can convert to int value. We can convert `100%` to 100000 value
